pageProps.content:
Experience

Baines’ River Camp is set on the northern bank of the mighty Zambezi River in one of Southern Africa’s wildest parks – the game-packed Lower Zambezi National Park.
This area in Zambia is rich in wildlife & offers guests an authentic safari experience in a pristine wilderness setting.
Named after naturalist & explorer Thomas Baines, the camp hosts a variety of exciting safari activities, including unique safari workshops where guests can learn about photography, bird watching or fly fishing.

Stay

There are 8 air-conditioned explorer suites & a 2-bedroom family suite at Baines’ River Camp, each equipped with an en-suite bathroom.
Each suite features a river-facing veranda with a large 2-meter sofa & 2 of the suites also offer outdoor showers - ideal for honeymooners.
The family suite is ideally suited to a young family or up to 3 adults. The unit comprises 2 bedrooms, a river-facing veranda with a 2-meter sofa & an open-plan lounge, dining room & kitchenette.
The communal area at Baines’ includes a lounge, dining room, pool, spa, bar & library.

Activities

A variety of exciting activities are available at Baines’ River Camp. Guests can explore the wilderness on game drives, river cruises, canoe safaris, guided walks or even fishing expeditions.
Relaxing treatments can be enjoyed at the wellness spa or guests can take a refreshing dip in the lodge’s swimming pool.

subfolders.title: Baines' River Camp
subfolders.description: Baines’ River Camp is set on the northern bank of the mighty Zambezi River in one of Southern Africa’s wildest parks – the game-packed Lower Zambezi National Park. This area in Zambia is rich in wildlife & offers guests an authentic safari experience in a pristine wilderness setting.

subfolders.title: Chiawa Camp
subfolders.description: On the banks of the mighty Zambezi River, in the heart of the wildlife-rich Lower Zambezi National Park in Zambia, lies the luxurious Chiawa Camp. This thatched & tented camp boasts a beautiful location from which to enjoy a variety of land & water-based safari activities.

subfolders.title: Old Mondoro
subfolders.description: The seasonal Old Mondoro (open from April to November) boasts a beautiful location on the banks of the great Zambezi River, overlooking a maze of hippo-filled channels & small islands in the Lower Zambezi National Park. This ‘back-to-basics’ camp focuses on providing guests with an authentic safari experience with enough comfort, without being side-tracked from the viewing wildlife.

subfolders.title: Royal Zambezi Lodge
subfolders.description: The award-winning Royal Zambezi Lodge is located within a private concession on the banks of the iconic Zambezi River in the world-renowned Lower Zambezi National Park. The camp offers guests a perfect blend between adventure & luxury while keeping the focus on wildlife.

subfolders.title: Sausage Tree Camp
subfolders.description: Deep in the heart of the rugged & remote Lower Zambezi National Park, lies Sausage Tree Camp – a luxurious tented camp with beautiful river views. It is not uncommon for elephants & resident hippos to wander through camp as they snack on new leaves, so guests will have ample opportunity for thrilling close-up wildlife encounters.

subfolders.title: Time & Tide Chongwe Suites
subfolders.description: Time + Tide Chongwe Suites enjoys an ideal location on the banks of the picturesque Chongwe & Zambezi Rivers in Zambia’s Lower Zambezi National Park. Magnificent views over 2 rivers, luxurious suites & exciting safari activities keep guests happy year after year.

whatWeLoveItems: Prime location in big game country
Stylish suites overlooking the Zambezi River
Game drives, river cruises & canoe safaris
